Total_Summary_Homelessness.Total_Homelessness_Annotation: The storm struck Newfoundland with hurricane-force winds and significant rainfall, but overall damage from the storm was minor.

Total_Homelessness_Per_Country.Homelessness_with_annotation: In Salinas, Puerto Rico, 2 people died after being struck by lightning while riding a jet ski.
Two people drowned off the coast of New Jersey due to rip currents: one in Ocean City and the other in Loveladies.

Bermuda was hit with sustained winds of 35 mph (60 km/h) as Hurricane Earl passed within about 90 mi (145 km) away from the island's eastern coast; much higher gusts were reported, including one of 67 mph (108 km/h) at the National Museum of Bermuda. There were localized power outages across the archipelago but no major damage was reported.

During a 36-hour period on September 10–12, 7–8 in (175–200 mm) of rain fell in the St. Johns area, causing overflowing along the Waterford River which led to a large amount of urban flooding. Similar rainfall amounts were also observed in communities throughout the Avalon Peninsula. Hurricane-force winds hit Grand Bank. Additionally, the cyclone caused rough surf which damaged the breakwater on the coast near Trepassey, Newfoundland and Labrador, bringing localized flooding to the area.
Despite being far away from the United Kingdom and Ireland, the countries still saw heavy rainfall and rough surf from its outer bands.

There were localized power outages across the archipelago but no major damage was reported.

During a 36-hour period on September 10–12, 7–8 in (175–200 mm) of rain fell in the St. Johns area, causing overflowing along the Waterford River which led to a large amount of urban flooding. Similar rainfall amounts were also observed in communities throughout the Avalon Peninsula. Hurricane-force winds hit Grand Bank. Additionally, the cyclone caused rough surf which damaged the breakwater on the coast near Trepassey, Newfoundland and Labrador, bringing localized flooding to the area.
Despite being far away from the United Kingdom and Ireland, the countries still saw heavy rainfall and rough surf from its outer bands.

Total_Summary_Injury.Total_Injury_Annotation: If the information is missing, assign 'NULL'.

Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: Hurricane Earl was a large, long-lived Category 2 hurricane that brought heavy rain to Puerto Rico and Newfoundland in September 2022 despite remaining mostly out to sea.

Total_Summary_Death.Total_Death_Annotation: Four fatalities were related to Hurricane Earl: two from lightning in Puerto Rico and two from rip currents in New Jersey.

Total_Death_Per_Country.Death_with_annotation: In Salinas, Puerto Rico, 2 people died after being struck by lightning while riding a jet ski.
Two people drowned off the coast of New Jersey due to rip currents: one in Ocean City and the other in Loveladies.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Death.Death_with_annotation: In Salinas, Puerto Rico, 2 people died after being struck by lightning while riding a jet ski.
Two people drowned off the coast of New Jersey due to rip currents: one in Ocean City and the other in Loveladies.

Total_Summary_Insured_Damage.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: overall damage from the storm was minor

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Insured_Da.Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_annotatio: 2 people died after being struck by lightning while riding a jet ski.
Two people drowned off the coast of New Jersey due to rip currents: one in Ocean City and the other in Loveladies.

Bermuda was hit with sustained winds of 35 mph (60 km/h) as Hurricane Earl passed within about 90 mi (145 km) away from the island's eastern coast; much higher gusts were reported, including one of 67 mph (108 km/h) at the National Museum of Bermuda. There were localized power outages across the archipelago but no major damage was reported. L.F. Wade International Airport reported gusts of 50–60 mph (80–97 km/h). Other parts of the island saw 1–3 in (25–76 mm) of rainfall.

During a 36-hour period on September 10–12, 7–8 in (175–200 mm) of rain fell in the St. Johns area, causing overflowing along the Waterford River which led to a large amount of urban flooding. Similar rainfall amounts were also observed in communities throughout the Avalon Peninsula. Hurricane-force winds hit Grand Bank. Additionally, the cyclone caused rough surf which damaged the breakwater on the coast near Trepassey, Newfoundland and Labrador, bringing localized flooding to the area. A wall holding out water was destroyed in Trepassey after large waves from Earl hit it. As far out as St. Anthony, Newfoundland and Labrador saw heavy rains associated with Earl.
Despite being far away from the United Kingdom and Ireland, the countries still saw heavy rainfall and rough surf from its outer bands.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Displaceme.Displacement_with_annotation: All travel to the territory was cancelled as Earl passed, including bus travel on the island.

Location_with_Annotation.Florida: As Earl passed east of Florida, strong swells hit the eastern coast of the state.
Location_with_Annotation.North Carolina: A large swell caused by Earl hit Cape Hatteras, North Carolina. Rip currents hit Surf City, North Carolina.
Location_with_Annotation.New Jersey: Two people drowned off the coast of New Jersey due to rip currents: one in Ocean City and the other in Loveladies.
Location_with_Annotation.New England: Rip currents also hit many areas of New England.
